hero.name: Shivank Khard
hero.title: Senior Full Stack Software Developer
hero.description: Building scalable, high-performance applications at industry leaders

bio: Full-stack software developer with over 4 years of experience designing and delivering scalable, high-performance applications at industry leaders like Apple and SAP Labs. Skilled in Java, Spring Framework, Kafka, SQL/NoSQL Database, Python, JavaScript, RESTful API integration, and CI/CD pipelines, with a proven track record of leading cross-functional teams and optimizing real-time distributed systems.

I'm passionate about building efficient, scalable software solutions that solve real-world problems. With experience across the full development lifecycle, I thrive in collaborative environments and enjoy mentoring others to grow together.

experience.title: Full Stack Software Developer
details: Led the design and development of a highly available distributed service in PLM, ensuring high scalability and near-zero downtime, demonstrating a commitment to robust and reliable system performance.

Spearheaded the migration of 8M+ records from CSV to Database using Python, collaborating across teams to ensure clean, well-structured data. Optimized performance enabling fast and reliable access for critical business use cases.

Collaborated with cross-functional teams across multiple time zones to deliver features on time, fostering a culture of open communication and knowledge sharing through regular sync-ups and documentation.
Conducted technical interviews for full-stack roles, ensuring a strong team fit and high-quality hires.

experience.title: Senior Software Developer
details: Spearheaded the development of Case Runtime, a pioneering new service based on the CMMN graphical notation. This service efficiently manages cases, allowing for dynamic handling of activities in response to evolving situations.

Designed and implemented the Metamodel for Case Runtime, ensuring seamless communication between design and runtime phases, while also leading CI/CD pipeline configuration, code review, and Kafka integration.
Presented cross-system workflow solutions for SAP SuccessFactors using SAP Build Process Automation to 1000+ attendees at SAP DCom, showcasing expertise and promoting SAP's automation capabilities.

Orchestrated performance test setup and analysis for the Archiving topic within the Process Visibility service. Utilized Apache JMeter technology to assess the impact of new features and informed decision-making through data-driven insights.

Led cross-functional collaboration with teams across multiple countries and worked closely with Product Managers and UX professionals to implement Stable IDs, enabling SAP Companion for new user assistance to over 3000 users.
Addressed security concerns mitigating Black Duck vulnerabilities, enhancing system reliability and data integrity.

projects.title: Dynamic Application Velocity for Fraud Detection
projects.subtitle: Citicorp Services
details: Developed new dynamic variables to reduce application fraud rates within the BestBuy portfolio.
Analyzed 5M credit card applications (through the door) of North American customers over a period of 9 months.
Developed new velocity variables, addressing missing data to improve fraud detection models.
Modelled Random Forest to understand the importance of various existing and new created variables in the data.
Achieved fraud rate of 31% in targeted segment starting from 2.53% initial fraud rate leveraging new variables.
Recommended addition of new variables-based rules leading to approx. $1.1 MM fraud loss savings per year.

projects.title: Recommendation System
projects.subtitle: Course Project under Prof. Purshottam Kar
details: Created a Recommendation System that predicts the top 5 products for each user based on their previous interaction data.
Reduced dimensionality of data starting from 16,385 variables (many sparse) to identify main components.
Used various Machine Learning techniques such as LwP, OvA, Decision Tree etc. to achieve high accuracy and fast predictions.

projects.title: LLM-Powered Referral Tool
projects.subtitle: Hackathon Project
details: Enhanced internal referral tool using LLMs to intelligently match candidate resumes with current job openings improving referral accuracy.
Evaludated and benchmarked multiple LLMs (Gemini, LLaMA, Claude, ChatGPT) through few shot training to identify the most effective tool
Collaborated in a cross-org, cross-country team of 5 to a scabale AI powered solution
